message.content:
cs.DC, cs.CR, cs.DS, cs.SY, cs.SE 

Reasoning: The paper deals with fault tolerance and security in distributed systems, which are topics that are commonly studied in the Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing (cs.DC) sub-category. The paper also discusses cryptographic operations and secrets, which are relevant to the Cryptography and Security (cs.CR) sub-category. The use of state-machine replication and consensus protocols suggests that the paper may also be relevant to the Distributed Systems (cs.DS) sub-category. The paper also deals with randomness generation and verifiable random functions, which are topics that are relevant to the Systems and Control (cs.SY) sub-category. Finally, the paper discusses the treatment of non-determinism in replicated services, which is a topic that is relevant to the Software Engineering (cs.SE) sub-category.
